metadata.title: CVE-2022-29900 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Mis-trained branch predictions for return instructions may allow arbitraryspeculative code execution under certain microarchitecture-dependentconditions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29900` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1015-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1015.20~20.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-46-lowlatency - 5.15.0-46.49~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-46-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-46.49~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-46-generic - 5.15.0-46.49~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-46-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-46.49~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-46-generic - 5.15.0-46.49~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-46-generic-64k - 5.15.0-46.49~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1017-aws - 5.15.0-1017.21~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1016-gcp - 5.15.0-1016.21~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1014-gke - 5.15.0-1014.17~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1017-azure - 5.15.0-1017.20~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1016-oracle - 5.15.0-1016.20~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1019-azure-fde - 5.15.0-1019.24~20.04.1.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1003-gkeop - 5.15.0-1003.5~20.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1033-ibm - 5.15.0-1033.36~20.04.1
No subscription required
